summary_text:
-- Page 1 --
Research Findings:
Modern Ethiopia (1855-
1974)
Unification and Modernization (1855-18890033_DATE__-1889)
• Emperor Tewodros II (1855-18680029_DATE__-1868):
- Overview: Ended the Era of Princes, reunified Ethiopia, and initi-
ated modernization.
 Emperor Yohannes IV (1872-18890025_DATE__-1889):
- Overview: Defended Ethiopia against Egyptian, Mahdist, and Ital-
ian threats.
- Monuments: Yohannes IV Palace in Mekelle.
- Government: Decentralized but unified under his suzerainty; em-
phasized religious Orthodoxy.
 Expansion and Independence (1889-19300021_DATE__-1930)
• Emperor Menelik II (1889-19130017_DATE__-1913):
- Overview: Defeated Italy at the Battle of Adwa (1896), expanded
borders, and founded Addis Ababa.
- Monuments: Menelik II Palace (Addis Ababa), St. George's Cathe-
dral, Entoto Maryam Church.
- Government: Established a modern cabinet, introduced the railway,
telephone, and postal system.
 First female monarch of modern Ethiopia; conservative
but oversaw early reforms by Ras Teferi (Haile Selassie).
- Monuments: Continued development of Addis Ababa and religious
sites.
- Government: Dual rule with Ras Teferi as Regent.
